translated: Björkman, Klas Johan Herman, Order Police Superintendent, Captain, Gothenburg, born August 12, 1888 in Berga, Kronob. L, son of Police Constable Gustaf Alfred B. and Ingrid Maria Svensdotter. Married in 1916 to ValboTg Smedberg. Children: Stina (born 1918) married to Anders Fraenkel, and Märta (born 1923). Completed high school in Halmstad in 1909, took a clerk exam in Lund in 1912, and graduated from officer training in 1912. Studied police work in Germany and England in 1929 and 1930. Was a second lieutenant in the Halland regiment in 1913, promoted to lieutenant in 1917 and captain in 1940. Worked as a constable in Halmstad from 1909-1910 and Gothenburg from 1913, central police constable and deputy police constable in 1914, detective chief superintendent in 1915, revenue inspector in 1916, order police superintendent in Gothenburg since 1919, including temporarily being Chief of Police, Deputy Police Superintendent, Police Security Chief, and First and Third Municipal Bailiff, and also served as head and teacher of the Gothenburg Police School since 1929. Member of the County Government in Taxation from 1917-1928, Chairman of Taxation since 1929, Expert in the Ministry of Social Affairs in developing proposals for the nearest regulations regarding police personnel, uniforms, official insignia, and weapons in 1925, Chairman of the Gothenburg Shooting District from 1929-1934, Chairman of the Gothenburg Shooting Society from 1938-1941, initiated the School Youth in Gothenburg Shooting Day in 1939, Chairman of the Association for the Promotion of School Youth in Gothenburg Shooting Exercises since 1944, Chairman of the Gothenburg Police Sports Association and Vice Chairman of the Swedish Police Sports Association 1939, Chairman for several years and since 1947 Chairman of the Gothenburg Sports Association, Member of the Board of the Gothenburg Animal Protection Association from 1921-1937, and thereafter Vice Chairman. He wrote a compendium for teaching criminal and order police procedures, brochures on traffic issues, and held several lectures in traffic and police matters. He received the Royal Order of Vasa in 1930, the Royal Order of the Sword, the Swedish Ski Association Gold Medal, the Gothenburg and Bohus County Ski Association Gold Medal, the Swedish Police Sports Association Gold Medal, the Gothenburg District Sports Association Gold Medal, the Gothenburg Gymnastics Association Gold Medal, the Gothenburg Ski Club Gold Medal, the Gothenburg Shooting Society Gold Medal, the Association for the Promotion of School Youth in Gothenburg Shooting Exercises Gold Medal, the Hvitlefeldtska Upper Secondary School Shooting Association Gold Medal, the Swedish Rifle Association Silver Medal, the Gothenburg Shooting District Gold Plaque, the Gothenburg Police Sports Association Gold Plaque, and the Badge for Meritorious Service in the Field of Fire Protection.

structured.description: Klas Johan Herman Björkman was a Swedish Police Officer, Captain, and Chairman of several organizations. He was born on August 12, 1888, in Berga, Kronob. L to Police Constable Gustaf Alfred B. and Ingrid Maria Svensdotter. He completed high school at Halmstad High School in 1909, took a clerk exam at Lund University in 1912, and graduated from officer training in 1912. He studied police work in Germany and England in 1929 and 1930. Björkman was a second lieutenant in the Halland regiment in 1913, promoted to lieutenant in 1917 and captain in 1940. He worked as a constable in Halmstad from 1909-1910 and Gothenburg from 1913. He served as order police superintendent in Gothenburg since 1919, including temporarily being Chief of Police, Deputy Police Superintendent, Police Security Chief, and First and Third Municipal Bailiff, and also served as head and teacher of the Gothenburg Police School since 1929. He was a member of the County Government in Taxation from 1917-1928. He was the Chairman of Taxation since 1929 and Expert in the Ministry of Social Affairs in developing proposals for the nearest regulations regarding police personnel, uniforms, official insignia, and weapons in 1925. He was the Chairman of the Gothenburg Shooting District from 1929-1934 and Chairman of the Gothenburg Shooting Society from 1938-1941. He initiated the School Youth in Gothenburg Shooting Day in 1939 and was the Chairman of the Association for the Promotion of School Youth in Gothenburg Shooting Exercises since 1944. He was the Chairman of the Gothenburg Police Sports Association and Vice Chairman of the Swedish Police Sports Association 1939, Chairman for several years, and since 1947 Chairman of the Gothenburg Sports Association. He was a Member of the Board of the Gothenburg Animal Protection Association from 1921-1937 and thereafter Vice Chairman. He wrote a compendium for teaching criminal and order police procedures, brochures on traffic issues, and held several lectures in traffic and police matters. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1930, the Royal Order of the Sword, the Swedish Ski Association Gold Medal, the Gothenburg and Bohus County Ski Association Gold Medal, the Swedish Police Sports Association Gold Medal, the Gothenburg District Sports Association Gold Medal, the Gothenburg Gymnastics Association Gold Medal, the Gothenburg Ski Club Gold Medal, the Gothenburg Shooting Society Gold Medal, the Association for the Promotion of School Youth in Gothenburg Shooting Exercises Gold Medal, the Hvitlefeldtska Upper Secondary School Shooting Association Gold Medal, the Swedish Rifle Association Silver Medal, the Gothenburg Shooting District Gold Plaque, the Gothenburg Police Sports Association Gold Plaque, and the Badge for Meritorious Service in the Field of Fire Protection.
